intro: Pabstiella henrique-aragonii, commonly known as the Brazilian orchid, is a rare epiphytic orchid native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It features a slender, wiry stem and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant has a unique sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to the humid, shaded environments of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
